scan_table_check.description: Credentials - i.e. user names and passwords must never be stored in a source control system repository. As an application file, a Data Source record may also be committed to a repository - and hence must not contain any credentials. The design of a Data Source record implies that credentials are story within the record - which makes it impossible to separate logic (the specifics of the data source) and data (credentials in that case).
scan_table_check.name: CodeSanity - Data Sources must not contain credentials
scan_table_check.resolution_details: In order to make use of Data Sources in an application that is maintained in a source control system, the required credentials must be added to the record before the Data Source is executed (e.g., by a Data Source Schedule) and then removed. Specifically the record must not contain any credentials when it is committed to source control.
scan_table_check.short_description: A Data Source record must not contain credentials
scan_table_check.sys_name: CodeSanity - Data Sources must not contain credentials
